p: Induction of diabetes mellitus is most commonly performed by using STZ due to its higher inductive rate and selectivity. It causes pancreatic β-cell destruction via DNA alkylation and strand breakage, thereby causing diabetes mellitus [ 36, 37]. It is similar in structure to glucose and hence competes with glucose for transport via pancreas beta cell membrane transporter GLUT-2 and is given for the laboratory animals in a fasting state to overcome competition by glucose for entry [ 21, 38]. Diabetes mellitus was effectively induced by administering STZ solution (150 mg/kg) to all groups of mice. This was validated after 72 hours of STZ injection with sustained hyperglycemia.
